questions.question: What is responsive web design?
options: Design that responds to user clicks
Design that adapts to different screen sizes
questions.explanation: Responsive web design ensures that websites work well on various devices and screen sizes.

questions.question: Which CSS property is commonly used for responsive design?
questions.explanation: Media queries are CSS rules that apply different styles based on device characteristics like screen size.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a favicon?
options: To display a small icon in browser tabs
questions.explanation: A favicon is a small icon that appears in browser tabs and bookmarks to represent a website.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to include external JavaScript files?
questions.explanation: The <script> tag is used to include JavaScript code or link to external JavaScript files.

questions.question: What is the purpose of semantic HTML elements?
options: To provide meaning and structure to content
questions.explanation: Semantic HTML elements like <header>, <nav>, <main>, <section> provide meaning and structure to web content.

questions.question: Which method is used to validate HTML forms?
questions.explanation: Form validation can be done using HTML5 attributes, CSS styling, and JavaScript for comprehensive validation.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag?
options: To create metadata about the HTML document
questions.explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as character encoding, viewport settings, and SEO information.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create flexible layouts?
questions.explanation: Flexbox (display: flex) is a CSS layout method that provides flexible and efficient ways to arrange elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of version control in web development?
options: To track changes and collaborate on code
questions.explanation: Version control systems like Git help developers track changes, collaborate, and manage different versions of their code.

questions.question: Which is the most important factor for website performance?
questions.explanation: Page load speed is crucial for user experience, SEO, and overall website performance.
